text: The 2018 New Mexico House of Representatives elections took place as part of the biennial United States elections. New Mexico voters elected state representatives in all 70 of the state house's districts. State representatives serve two-year terms in the New Mexico House of Representatives. The New Mexico Legislature provides a statewide map of State House districts here, and the U.S. Census offers individual district maps here. A primary election on June 5, 2018 determined which candidates appear on the November 6 general election ballot. Primary election results can be obtained from the New Mexico Secretary of State's website. In the 2016 state House elections, Democrats flipped 5 seats from Republican hands and took control of the House by increasing their seats from 33 to 38. This put Democrats in effective control of the New Mexico House of Representatives. To claim control of the chamber from Democrats, the Republicans would need to net 4 House seats. However, in the elections, the Democrats made a net gain of 9 seats, increasing their seats from 38 to 47. ==Summary of results== {| class="sortable wikitable" style="font-size:95%;line-height:14px;" ! class="unsortable"| State House District ! class="unsortable"|Incumbent ! colspan="2"| Party ! class="unsortable"|Elected Representative ! colspan="2"| Party |- | 1st | Rod Montoya | style="background:;"| | Rep | Rod Montoya | style="background:;"| | Rep |- | 2nd | James Strickler | style="background:;"| | Rep | James Strickler | style="background:;"| | Rep |- | 3rd | Paul Bandy | style="background:;"| | Rep | Paul Bandy | style="background:;"| | Rep |- | 4th | Sharon Clahchischilliage | style="background:;"| | Rep | Anthony Allison | style="background:;"| | Dem |- | 5th | Doreen Wonda Johnson | style="background:;"| | Dem | Doreen Wonda Johnson | style="background:;"| | Dem |- | 6th | Eliseo Alcon | style="background:;"| | Dem | Eliseo Alcon | style="background:;"| | Dem |- | 7th | Kelly Fajardo | style="background:;"| | Rep | Kelly Fajardo | style="background:;"| | Rep |- | 8th | Alonzo Baldonado | style="background:;"| | Rep | Alonzo Baldonado | style="background:;"| | Rep |- | 9th | Patricia Lundstrom | style="background:;"| | Dem | Patricia Lundstrom | style="background:;"| | Dem |- | 10th | G. Clahchischilliage (R), District 4 *Jimmie Hall (R), District 28 *David Adkins (R), District 29 *Ricky Little (R), District 53 *Monica Youngblood (R), District 68 ====Recounts==== Three races are within one percentage point and were therefore eligible for an automatic recount. *District 20: Democrat Abbas Akhil leads Republican incumbent Jim Dines by 109 votes (0.94%). *District 22: Republican incumbent Gregg Schmedes leads Democrat Jessica Velasquez by 138 votes (0.84%). *District 63: Republican Martin Zamora leads Democratic incumbent George Dodge by 27 votes (0.46%). ==Detailed results==
